result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin G Garcia Leal

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim L.Y.C (person, property, residence or family).  Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.

3:12 PM Defendant Martin G Garcia Leal in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Martin G Garcia Leal.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski. Interpreter:  Vicki Bermudez.  Defense files a bond motion.  Defense makes further argument.  State objects with argument.  BTC:  Bond modified to $25,000 cash, same conditions. Defense asks for another status conference to review discovery.  State requests a jury trial date.  BTC: Court will set the trial date.
Jury trial scheduled for March 21, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for March 10, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Final pre-trial on March 10, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial on March 21, 2023 at 08:30 am.

9:18 AM Defendant Martin G Garcia Leal in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Martin G Garcia Leal.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  There is no interpreter available today.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

8:46 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Martin G Garcia Leal in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Martin G Garcia Leal. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard. Interpreter:  Vicki Bermudez, DS.  Defense has rec'd discovery.  Defense believes some reports are missing.  State has not extended an offer based on waiting on reports.  State is waiting the SANE exam.  Defense hasn't reviewed the discovery with the deft.  BTC: Matter set over for a status.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.

1:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Martin G Garcia Leal appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan appeared by video for Martin G Garcia Leal. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Interpreter:  Vicki Bermudez, Previously sworn.
Defense moves to dismiss count one with argument. Defense withdraws Motion. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
